refnamediv.refpurpose: Font handling and rendering with the Xft backend

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "display" gpointer : Write / Construct Only "screen" gint : Write / Construct Only

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The Xft library is a library for displaying fonts on the X window system; internally it uses the fontconfig library to locate font files, and the FreeType library to load and render fonts. The Xft backend is the recommended Pango font backend for screen display with X. (The Cairo back end is another possibility.)

Using the Xft backend is generally straightforward; pango_xft_get_context() creates a context for a specified display and screen. You can then create a PangoLayout with that context and render it with pango_xft_render_layout(). At a more advanced level, the low-level fontconfig options used for rendering fonts can be affected using pango_xft_set_default_substitute(), and pango_xft_substitute_changed().

A range of functions for drawing pieces of a layout, such as individual layout lines and glyphs strings are provided. You can also directly create a PangoXftRenderer. Finally, in some advanced cases, it is useful to derive from PangoXftRenderer. Deriving from PangoXftRenderer is useful for two reasons. One reason is be to support custom attributes by overriding PangoRendererClass virtual functions like 'prepare_run' or 'draw_shape'. The reason is to customize exactly how the final bits are drawn to the destination by overriding the PangoXftRendererClass virtual functions 'composite_glyphs' and 'composite_trapezoids'.

refsect2.title: PangoXftFont
refsect2.para: PangoXftFont is an implementation of PangoFcFont using the Xft library for rendering. It is used in conjunction with PangoXftFontMap.

refsect2.title: PangoXftFontMap
refsect2.para: PangoXftFontMap is an implementation of PangoFcFontMap suitable for the Xft library as the renderer. It is used in to create fonts of type PangoXftFont.

refsect2.title: PANGO_RENDER_TYPE_XFT

warning.para: PANGO_RENDER_TYPE_XFT is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: A string constant that was used to identify shape engines that work with the Xft backend. See PANGO_RENDER_TYPE_FC for the replacement.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_get_context ()

warning.para: pango_xft_get_context has been deprecated since version 1.22 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use pango_xft_get_font_map() followed by pango_font_map_create_context() instead.

refsect2.para: Retrieves a PangoContext appropriate for rendering with Xft fonts on the given screen of the given display.

listitem.simpara: an X display.
an X screen.
the new PangoContext.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_get_font_map ()
refsect2.para: Returns the PangoXftFontmap for the given display and screen. The fontmap is owned by Pango and will be valid until the display is closed.

listitem.simpara: an X display
the screen number of a screen within display
a PangoFontMap object, owned by Pango.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_set_default_substitute ()
refsect2.programlisting: void pango_xft_set_default_substitute (Display *display, int screen, PangoXftSubstituteFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify notify);
refsect2.para: Sets a function that will be called to do final configuration substitution on a FcPattern before it is used to load the font. This function can be used to do things like set hinting and antialiasing options.

listitem.simpara: an X Display
the screen number of a screen within display
function to call to to do final config tweaking on FcPattern objects.
data to pass to func
function to call when data is no longer used.

refsect2.title: PangoXftSubstituteFunc ()
refsect2.para: Function type for doing final config tweaking on prepared FcPatterns.

listitem.simpara: the FcPattern to tweak.
user data.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_substitute_changed ()
refsect2.para: Call this function any time the results of the default substitution function set with pango_xft_set_default_substitute() change. That is, if your substitution function will return different results for the same input pattern, you must call this function.

listitem.simpara: an X Display
the screen number of a screen within display

refsect2.title: pango_xft_shutdown_display ()
refsect2.para: Release any resources that have been cached for the combination of display and screen. Note that when the X display is closed, resources are released automatically, without needing to call this function.

listitem.simpara: an X display
the screen number of a screen within display

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_get_font ()
refsect2.para: Returns the XftFont of a font.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont.
the XftFont associated to font, or NULL if font is NULL.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_get_display ()
refsect2.para: Returns the X display of the XftFont of a font.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont.
the X display of the XftFont associated to font.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_has_char ()

warning.para: pango_xft_font_has_char is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Determines whether font has a glyph for the codepoint wc.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont for the Xft backend
Unicode codepoint to look up
TRUE if font has the requested codepoint.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_lock_face ()

warning.para: pango_xft_font_lock_face is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Gets the FreeType FT_Face associated with a font, This face will be kept around until you call pango_xft_font_unlock_face().

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont.
the FreeType FT_Face associated with font.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_unlock_face ()

warning.para: pango_xft_font_unlock_face is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Releases a font previously obtained with pango_xft_font_lock_face().

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_get_glyph ()

warning.para: pango_xft_font_get_glyph is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Gets the glyph index for a given Unicode character for font. If you only want to determine whether the font has the glyph, use pango_xft_font_has_char().

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont for the Xft backend
Unicode codepoint to look up
the glyph index, or 0, if the Unicode character does not exist in the font.

refsect2.title: pango_xft_font_get_unknown_glyph ()

warning.para: pango_xft_font_get_unknown_glyph is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Returns the index of a glyph suitable for drawing wc as an unknown character.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont.
the Unicode character for which a glyph is needed.
a glyph index into font.

refsect2.title: PangoXftRenderer
refsect2.para: PangoXftRenderer is a subclass of PangoRenderer used for rendering with Pango's Xft backend. It can be used directly, or it can be further subclassed to modify exactly how drawing of individual elements occurs.

refsect2.title: PangoXftRendererClass

listitem.simpara: draw the specified trapezoids using the current color and other attributes for part
draw the specified glyphs using the current foreground color and other foreground attributes

refsect2.title: pango_xft_renderer_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new PangoXftRenderer to allow rendering Pango objects with the Xft library. You must call pango_xft_renderer_set_draw() before using the renderer.

listitem.simpara: an X display
the index of the screen for display to which rendering will be done
the newly created PangoXftRenderer, which should be freed with g_object_unref().

refsect2.title: pango_xft_renderer_set_draw ()
refsect2.para: Sets the XftDraw object that the renderer is drawing to. The renderer must not be currently active.

listitem.simpara: a PangoXftRenderer
a XftDraw

refsect2.title: pango_xft_renderer_set_default_color ()
refsect2.para: Sets the default foreground color for a XftRenderer.

listitem.simpara: a XftRenderer
the default foreground color

refsect2.title: pango_xft_render_transformed ()
refsect2.programlisting: void pango_xft_render_transformed (XftDraw *draw, XftColor *color, PangoMatrix *matrix, PangoFont *font, PangoGlyphString *glyphs, int x, int y);
refsect2.para: Renders a PangoGlyphString onto a XftDraw, possibly transforming the layed-out coordinates through a transformation matrix. Note that the transformation matrix for font is not changed, so to produce correct rendering results, the font must have been loaded using a PangoContext with an identical transformation matrix to that passed in to this function.

listitem.simpara: an XftDraw
the color in which to draw the glyphs
a PangoMatrix, or NULL to use an identity transformation
the font in which to draw the string
the glyph string to draw
the x position of the start of the string (in Pango units in user space coordinates)
the y position of the baseline (in Pango units in user space coordinates)
